thread.title: Michael Domschot

author: Michael Domschot
title: Michael Domschot
text:
Ordered days before Christmas - overnight. Arrived as advertised, well packed and on time! Great experience.
Here is a 30 Day Review of said watch
Pulled the trigger on this December 2016. Fast overnight shipping. Transaction very smooth. (as advertised)
This watch uses the new H-10 movement, which is based on the ETA 2836-2, the regulator has been deleted. Power is reserve 80 hrs.
I was a bit hesitant of the new H-10, as it is not easily regulated. No worries! after a month, it is running at +2/sec total. It wears 12 hours on wrist and spends the remainder of the time crown down on the dresser.
I tested the rest time in all positions early on and it runs the nearly same regardless of position (testing only measuring against atomic clock).
It's positional accuracy is very good. Amazing experience so far with the H-10.
The fit n finish is impeccable, the bracelet is above average and all brushed - comfortable. Downside is only 2 pin positions on the micro adjust. 7" wrist is fine.
Lume is applied to hands and numerals - charges very bright but settles to a duller version that does last well into the night.
Sapphire is double domed and un-coated. This is ok as the hour track is "brushed" and provides a nice contrast to the dial face. Red tip in seconds hand is a nice touch.
All in all this is a nice refined watch with modern specifications that is based on a classic Tool watch.
If you like classic design with upgrades, don't wait - you can't go wrong at this price point with the Hammy.
Pros:
Affordable
Extremely Readable
100m WR (I have showered and swam with it)
Nice modern spec'd version of a classic functional field watch
Accuracy (YMMV) mine is insanely good
Power reserve
Fit n Finish very good
20mm lugs (its a strap monster - nato etc)
Signed Crown
Swiss
Cons:
no screw down crown (it IS usable in water - I do daily)
(make sure crown is seated!!)
no AR coating (if you like or require it)
2 pin position on bracelet micro adjustment
really not decorated, yet has see thru back
